intro: Xanthosia diffusa, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of bright yellow pea-like flowers. Xanthosia diffusa is well adapted to various soil types and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing nectar for native pollinators.
